instruction: Can hyperspectral-based methods accurately estimate skin thickness in clinical settings, and how does this compare to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, hyperspectral-based methods can accurately estimate skin thickness in clinical settings. The related study states that the researchers developed a method that combined a physics-based model of human skin with machine learning and hyperspectral imaging to estimate physiological skin parameters, including skin thickness. They also developed a protocol to test their methodology using ultrasound to acquire a gold standard dataset for skin thickness estimation. The results of their study showed mean absolute errors on the order of the ultrasound resolution, indicating that the hyperspectral-based method was able to accurately estimate skin thickness.
